New Records: Grizzlies rookie Jaylen Wells surpassed his career high in scoring during the third quarter and finished with 30 points.
Key Match Events: The Memphis Grizzlies and Sacramento Kings combined for 202 points through three quarters in a battle of fast and explosive offenses.
Sacramento spent most of the night leading until two Scotty Pippen Jr. free throws gave Memphis a lead with eight minutes left in the fourth quarter.
A stretch of timely shot-making from the Kings allowed them to pull away and create room. Memphis spent the last seven minutes playing from behind in a 138-133 loss at Golden 1 Center.
Jaren Jackson Jr. added 28 points for the Grizzlies but fouled out with 43.8 seconds left after picking up all six of his fouls in the fourth quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Memphis Grizzlies will get three rotation players back on Friday. Zach Edey, Brandon Clarke and Jake LaRavia are all returning. All three players were listed as questionable before the game. Yuki Kawamura, who was also questionable, will be out.
